meanings.definition: A device used to introduce air into a substance, such as soil or water.
meanings.sent1: The aerators in the fish tank help keep the water clean and fresh.
meanings.sent2: The gardener used aerators to improve the quality of the soil in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The aerators in the pond decided to throw a party to celebrate their bubbles.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like aerators, bringing life and light to the room.
meanings.sent5: The aerators hummed softly, like a choir of tiny angels singing to the plants.

meanings.sent1: The aerators worked diligently to ensure the soil was properly aerated.
meanings.sent2: In the park, you can see aerators using special tools to aerate the grass.
meanings.sent3: The aerators at the gym decided to start a new exercise class focused on aerating.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as aerators, bringing fresh perspectives to the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The aerators in the field moved rhythmically, like dancers aerating the earth.
